image.altText: Brown, muddy floodwaters swirling around the bases of lines of trees and streetlights

props.synopsis: Severe winds have lashed the state's south-east and heavy rains smashed coastal communities. Follow live.

title.children: Ipswich's Bremer River peaks just below major flood level

image.altText: Dutton Australian flag concern

props.synopsis: Tony Burke has accused Peter Dutton of playing into the hands of organised criminals behind the fake terrorism plot.

title.children: Labor says Dutton 'conned' by caravan hoax and unfit for national security role

image.altText: Bob Coulthurst sits in a dinghy as he navigates through a flooded clarence river in northern nsw

props.synopsis: Locals in the riverside town of Lawrence in northern NSW are waiting for flooding to recede, but unlike the 2022 floods they are less anxious and "know what's going to happen".

title.children: Properties turned into islands at riverside town in northern NSW

image.altText: Man with floodwaters up to his shins stands with dog in backyard

props.synopsis: Working out how to claim insurance is confusing at the best of times. Here's how to claim, and the steps to take to make the insurance process easier.

title.children: So, your house is flooded. Here's how to claim insurance

image.altText: aerial picutres show a small town submerged in brown floodwaters

props.synopsis: Showers are expected to ease across sodden south-east Queensland, but several flood warnings remain in place following ex-Cyclone Alfred, with extensive flooding recorded in Queensland's Lockyer Valley.

title.children: Heavy rainfall set to ease in wake of ex-Cyclone Alfred as flood warnings continue

image.altText: A number of soldiers in stand in along a corridor with their backs turned to the camera and the poppy-adorned roll of honour.

props.synopsis: Will a massive expansion of the Australian War Memorial allow it to evolve or destroy what makes it special?

title.children: Fears Australia's 'solemn' war memorial risks becoming a 'Disneyland of war'

image.altText: Professor Richard Scolyer

props.synopsis: Former Australian of the Year Richard Scolyer says he is heartbroken to reveal his brain cancer has returned after revolutionary treatment kept the aggressive tumour at bay for more than 18 months.

title.children: 'I'm not ready to die': Professor Richard Scolyer reveals heartbreaking prognosis

image.altText: A woman makes moonshine in Bihar, India.

props.synopsis: The largest alcohol prohibition experiment in the world, in the Indian state of Bihar, has triggered a raft of unintended consequences.

title.children: A law to protect women created a thriving criminal underworld

image.altText: White rectangular, concrete building with glass windows and brown glass entrance way and blue sky.

props.synopsis: With a federal election on the horizon in May, both the opposition and intelligence analysts have warned that there's a risk the report will remain buried forever.

title.children: Intelligence agencies' review yet to be released eight months on

image.altText: An intricate golden star shape above capital letters that spell out "The Star" advertising a casino.

props.synopsis: Against all odds, Star Entertainment has managed to avoid sliding into administration for now. But its near demise poses bigger problems for a glittering world that risks being consigned to a bygone era.

title.children: A stone-cold bluff saved Star for now but it's not yet in the clear

image.altText: The Stena Immaculate, a large commercial shipping vessel, sitting at a dock.

props.synopsis: Authorities say 32 people who sustained injuries have been brought to shore following the collision off the north-eastern coast of England.

title.children: Oil tanker and cargo vessel on fire after collision off UK coast

image.altText: Donald Trump and Malcolm Turnbull shake hands.

props.synopsis: The US president's social media broadside came after Mr Turnbull criticised him on US television.

title.children: 'Bipartisan gaslighting': Malcolm Turnbull reacts to Trump's personal attack

image.altText: Woman stands in front of sandbags with arms crossed

props.synopsis: The Lockyer Valley, about 120 kilometres west of Brisbane, is being hit with the effects of ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred, with some communities ordered to evacuate.

title.children: Lockyer Valley residents watch as front yards become an 'ocean'

image.altText: A man wearing a black shirt with a white logo that says "DOGE" shows it off to the camera smiling

props.synopsis: The owner of X has announced the incident on his own platform after users around the world reported issues on the site.

title.children: Elon Musk says X outages due to 'massive cyberattack'

image.altText: Supporters of impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol wave US and South Korean flags.

props.synopsis: Wearing symbolic white helmets and waving "Stop the Steal" flags, the young men of the "white skull squad" are back on the streets of South Korea and wanting the US to intervene in their country's democracy.

title.children: South Korea's 'white skull squad' embraces MAGA-style politics

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Woman with cup in hand sits on couch with laptop on lap at home

props.synopsis: Suddenly, working from home is being debated in Canberra. But who benefits if it becomes an election issue?

title.children: The work from home debate is 'dangerous territory' for politicians

image.altText: A young, fair-haired man with a neat beard lies in bed. His nose is swollen and his face is bruised.

props.synopsis: A solicitor who was bashed in his hometown says he was thinking "this could be it" as he was kicked and punched by a gang of young men.

title.children: Young lawyer haunted by savage bashing in Bendigo

props.synopsis: Former NSW treasurer Matt Kean has slammed his own party over its advocacy of nuclear power, calling plans to subsidise nuclear reactors "nonsense".

title.children: 'Like building a Blockbuster': Liberal slams party's nuclear plan

image.altText: A large bin parked in a carpark outside a childcare facility

props.synopsis: A former employee of childcare provider Genius Education says the company owes staff thousands in unpaid superannuation and workers were not able to say a proper goodbye to the children they cared for.

title.children: Worker claims childcare company owes staff thousands of dollars in super

image.altText: A young Thai woman in a traditional chut thai, and a man in a green police uniform

props.synopsis: Thitisan Utthanaphon was serving a life sentence in a Bangkok prison for murder.

title.children: Policeman behind viral 'torture' video found dead in Thai jail

image.altText: Three women sit a timber meeting table.

props.synopsis: Samoa's first female prime minister ignored a taunt about her marital status in defeating the second attempt to oust her in two weeks.

title.children: Samoa's PM told to 'get married' so someone could 'advise' her properly

image.altText: Shipping in the port of Burnie, Tasmania.

props.synopsis: The privatisation of public assets has been a recurring theme across Australia for four decades, but one state has almost entirely avoided the trend: Tasmania.

title.children: Tasmania has been immune to privatisation, but has it worked elsewhere?

image.altText: A person in handcuffs.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government will explore raising the threshold for granting bail for serious crimes in an effort to quell public concerns about safety.

title.children: Debate rages inside Allan government around bail laws as crime soars

image.altText: Two middle-aged men, one in a tight, olive green shirt and the other in a suit, shake hands in front of a woooden wall.

props.synopsis: Russia has told Australia there will be "grave consequences" if it puts "boots on the ground" in Ukraine as part of a Western peacekeeping operation proposed by UK Prime Minister Kier Starmer.

title.children: Russia warns Australia of 'grave consequences' if it sends peacekeepers to Ukraine

image.altText: A man with a long beard, wearing a navy jumper.

props.synopsis: The man accused of murdering 24-year-old Cairns woman Toyah Cordingley likely contributed to DNA on a stick found at her burial site, but not on the lead of her dog which was found tied tightly to a tree nearby.

title.children: DNA at Toyah Cordingley's burial site 3.7b times more likely to be accused's than another's, court hears

image.altText: Virat Kohli holds up Champions Trophy as teammates celebrate

props.synopsis: India's triumph at the 2025 Champions Trophy is the crowning moment for the world's best white ball team. Sadly, many won't see it that way, through no fault of the players themselves, writes Chris de Silva.

title.children: India's Champions Trophy win a tainted one despite team's dominance

image.altText: A police car waits in the driveway of a suburban large property

props.synopsis: The Australian Federal Police said the caravan, filled with explosives, was "never going to cause a mass casualty event".

title.children: Police say Dural caravan filled with explosives was 'fabricated terrorist plot'

image.altText: The Duke of Orleans bay east of Esperance.

props.synopsis: Wharton Beach, east of Esperance, has been closed after the surfer was spotted in distress just after midday.

title.children: Surfer missing in WA's south-east after shark attack

image.altText: Mount Torrens dairy farmers Rodney Herrmann and Ben Wilhelm stand on dry and cracked ground, in front of a small dam

props.synopsis: Mount Torrens dairy farmers Rodney Herrmann and Ben Wilhelm say they would be "in big trouble" if they were not able to pump water from a neighbour's dam. They are calling on the state government to provide more support for farmers enduring the current drought conditions.

title.children: SA farmers 'battling through some of the toughest times I can remember'

image.altText: A line of people in camouflage gear, standing outside on a footpath, carrying long guns

props.synopsis: The violence broke out when gunmen loyal to ousted president Bashar al-Assad ambushed a Syrian security patrol near the port city of Latakia.

title.children: Syrian defence ministry says Assad loyalists thwarted after 1,000 killed in clashes

image.altText: Martin Dole 4

props.synopsis: Acting Police Commissioner Martin Dole has rejected calls for an inquiry into police executive appointments clouded by adverse ICAC findings against his predecessor, including his own promotion to deputy commissioner.

title.children: Acting NT top cop rejects call for police review after ICAC scandal

image.altText: A bird's eye photo of woman at centre of bright red circle of wool, with ankles tied in wool and tearing piece with her mouth.

props.synopsis: Step inside the Asia Pacific Triennial (APT), QAGOMA's flagship program. This year it features more than 500 works from artists in more than 30 countries, including Nepal, Hawaii, Aotearoa New Zealand, Cambodia, Mongolia, Saudi Arabia, Timor-Leste and Uzbekistan.

title.children: Prepare to be challenged and moved at Asia Pacific art exhibition

image.altText: Three women watch a television at a group function

props.synopsis: While most seats have a clear winner, there are several that are going down to the wire as counting continues in the 2025 WA election.

title.children: These are the seats still on a knife edge as WA election vote counting continues
